intro: Cleanthes hieracioides var. thrincioides, commonly known as the Thrincoides gentian, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a spurred structure characteristic of the genus Cleanthes. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
